retrofit2

Interface CallAdapter<R,T>


  • public interface CallAdapter<R,T>
    Adapts a Call with response type R into the type of T. Instances are created by a factory which is installed into the Retrofit instance.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  CallAdapter.Factory
      Creates CallAdapter instances based on the return type of the service interface methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T adapt(Call<R> call)
      Returns an instance of T which delegates to call.
      java.lang.reflect.Type responseType()
      Returns the value type that this adapter uses when converting the HTTP response body to a Java object.

    • Method Detail

      • responseType

        java.lang.reflect.Type responseType()
        Returns the value type that this adapter uses when converting the HTTP response body to a Java object. For example, the response type for Call<Repo> is Repo. This type is used to prepare the call passed to #adapt.

        Note: This is typically not the same type as the returnType provided to this call adapter's factory.

      • adapt

        T adapt(Call<R> call)
        Returns an instance of T which delegates to call.

        For example, given an instance for a hypothetical utility, Async, this instance would return a new Async<R> which invoked call when run. 

        
 @Override
 public <R> Async<R> adapt(final Call<R> call) {
   return Async.create(new Callable<Response<R>>() {
     @Override
     public Response<R> call() throws Exception {
       return call.execute();
     }
   });
 }
